data.name: AdvancedMachine_MachineAlreadyConnected_Message
data.value: A machine connection is already established. Terminate current connection and reconnect with these updated settings?

data.name: AutoConnect_Duplicate_CncId
data.value: Tool location ID must be unique.

data.name: AutoConnect_Enabled.Text
data.value: Connect/disconnect automatically when the machine performs a tool change

data.name: AvailableMachineActions_FromMachine_Header.Text
data.value: The following actions can be sent directly from the NC code to the Sensorized Tools software. Each action contains an action type, specifying which action it is, and a value, specifying a relevant value such as a new load limit value. The value field is not always in use. The last received time and value can be used to test functionality prior to use in production.

data.name: AvailableMachineActions_ToMachine_Header.Text
data.value: All actions below create an NC interrupt and will run a sub-program specific to that action type where you can decide on the correct action for your process. Each action has a type, specifying which event it is, and a value field. The value field is not always in use. Use the "Send test signal" buttons below to test each action type prior to use in production.

data.name: Battery_Calculating
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Battery status - Calculating. This is shown while the software is still gathering data and calculating the time remaining of the batterys capacity.

data.name: Battery_CriticallyLowMessage
data.value: Battery is critically low, and will run out soon. Charge the battery or replace it with a charged one to continue monitoring the process.

data.name: Battery_Empty
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Means the battery is empty.

data.name: Battery_Full
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) The battery is at 100%.

data.name: Button_Browse
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Text on button bringing up a "browse" window where the user can find and select a file.

data.name: Button_Close
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) This is used on buttons or instructins to close (or hide) a popup or view.

data.name: Button_Connect
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) The text on the button used to connect (with bluetooth) to the tool.

data.name: Button_Continue
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design)

data.name: Button_Discard
data.comment: Button text for if a user want to discard changes

data.name: Button_Disconnect
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Button for disconnecting from device.

data.name: Button_Later
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Button for postponing an action.

data.name: Button_Stay
data.comment: Button text for when prompting a user to stay on a page

data.name: Button_UpdateNow
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Button for starting the update process.

data.name: Common_DateFilterFirst
data.comment: Label for the first allowed date in a date filter.

data.name: Common_DateFilterLast
data.comment: Label for the last allowed date in a date filter.

data.name: Common_LastCalibrated
data.comment: Short title describing a date/time

data.name: Common_Max
data.comment: Short text to discribe a maximum.

data.name: Common_MaxLoad
data.comment: Maximum load (force in Newtons)

data.name: Common_MaxTemperature
data.comment: Maximum temperature allowed

data.name: Common_Next
data.comment: One word description of an action to go to something like the next page, or next object.

data.name: Common_Pass
data.comment: One passing of a procedure.

data.name: Common_Reset
data.comment: One word description of an action to reset something to the starting position, or an earlier state

data.name: Common_ResetMessage
data.value: Are you sure that you want to reset? All data will be lost.

data.name: Common_RestartMessage
data.value: Are you sure that you want to restart? All progress will be lost.

data.name: Common_Start
data.comment: To start something

data.name: Connection_Bad_Notification_Text
data.value: No data have been received from the sensorized tool for several seconds. Make sure the electronics are powered on and still in range.
data.comment: Notification text when no data have been received for several seconds. Also provides some troubleshooting to make sure the sensors are powered on and is still in range.

data.name: Connection_Bad_Notification_Title
data.comment: Notification title decribing that the connection is bad

data.name: Connect_Notification_Unable_To_Connect_Title
data.comment: Notification title for alerting the user that the app could not establish a connection to the tool.

data.name: Connect_Notification_Unable_To_Initialize_Text
data.value: A problem was encountered while reading sensorized tool information. Please try again. If the problem persists, please contact support.
data.comment: Notification text for alerting the user that the app could not read tool information. Encourage the user to try again, and contact support if the problem persists.

data.name: Copyright
data.comment: The {0} must be left in place. It is a placeholder for the current year, which will be inserted in code.

data.name: Crop_Too_Short
data.value: Could not crop to selection. Minimum length of recording after crop must exceed {0} seconds.

data.name: DateAscending
data.comment: Option for ordering a list by date, ascending.

data.name: DateDescending
data.comment: Option for ordering a list by date, descending.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_EliminateBacklashStepStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Jog the calibration head carefully {0} radially into the component. The indicator to the right should increase while you are jogging the sensorized tool, indicating it is being loaded as expected.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_EliminateBacklashStepStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Leave the bar at {0} radial position, then click "Continue".

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_EliminateBacklashStepStep_Subtext.Text
data.value: In order to minimize errors during calibration, you need to pre-load the sensorized tool in this step prior to the rest of the calibration sequence.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishingStep_Confirm_Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to save the new calibration values to your tool? This will overwrite the previous calibration values and cannot be undone.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStepFailed_ListA.Text
data.value: One or more steps were of incorrect length (i.e. a "double step").

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStepFailed_ListB.Text
data.value: The machine was moving during measurement.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStepFailed_ListC.Text
data.value: The sensorized tool or component is not sufficiently clamped.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStepFailed_SubText.Text
data.value: The generated calibration values are not consistent enough to recommend saving them. Please review your set-up and process, and try again. Contact us for help if the problem persists.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Jog the sensorized tool radially out of contact with the component.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Review the calibration by jogging carefully in contact with the component again. Note the current deflection before jogging a few moderate steps radially, i.e. {0}. The increase in the current deflection value, shown on the right, should be close to {0}.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_ListC.Text
data.value: Save the calibration using the "Save" button, or click "Cancel" to abort and continue using your previous calibration values.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_NotApproved_StepAboveExpected
data.value: Calibration step {0} measurements were {1} % higher than expected.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_NotApproved_StepBelowExpected
data.value: Calibration step {0} measurements were {1} % lower than expected.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_NotApproved_StepNoisy
data.value: Movement or noise detected during calibration step {0}.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_NotApproved_StepSizes
data.value: The measurements indicate inconsistent step sizes.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_NotApproved_TouchStepNoisy
data.value: Movement or noise detected when setting an updated reference point in contact with the component.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_FinishStep_SubText.Text
data.value: Please review the calibration and choose whether or not to save it in the tool.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_InitialNoLoadStep_Text.Text
data.value: This step is required prior to the pre-loading step.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_InitialTouchWorkpieceStep_Text.Text
data.value: This step sets a reference point in slight contact with the component.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_IntroductionStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Ensure the sensorized tool is securely clamped at the correct tool angle.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_IntroductionStep_ListB.Text
data.value: The clamped overhang length must be within the sensorized tool's design specification.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_IntroductionStep_ListC.Text
data.value: Mount a calibration head to the front interface. (Contact Sandvik Coromant if you need a calibration head.)

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_MeasurementStep_AccumulatedMotion.Text
data.value: Target accumulated radial motion after this step: {0}.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_MeasurementStep_FirstListA.Text
data.value: Jog the sensorized tool {0} radially to load it.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_MeasurementStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Jog the sensorized tool an additional {0} radially to load it.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_MeasurementStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Keep the adapter still in this position and click "Continue".

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_MeasurementStep_Text.Text
data.value: Position the sensorized tool for the step {0} calibration measurement.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_NoLoadStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Please jog the sensorized tool so it is visibly not in contact with the component.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_NoLoadStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Ensure that the machine is fully stationary, then click "Continue".

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_PrepareProcessStep_ListA.Text
data.value: The contact surface of the calibration head (marked orange in the figure) should be placed flush with or a short distance inside the component so that it will make contact with the component during calibration.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_PrepareProcessStep_ListB.Text
data.value: During calibration you will be asked to jog radial distances in the direction intended for cutting, while in contact with the component, and move in and out of contact. You will be guided through each step.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_PrepareProcessStep_ListC.Text
data.value: You may choose to jog manually or program a calibration NC program.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_PrepareProcessStep_ListD.Text
data.value: NB: The spindle should not be rotated. It should be kept in exactly the same position throughout the calibration!

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_SetUpComponentStep_ListA.Text
data.value: For optimal results, the calibration may be performed on a component closely resembling the actual component to be machined.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_SetUpComponentStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Make sure the component is clamped and supported in a representative manner.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_SetUpComponentStep_ListC.Text
data.value: The calibration should happen on a machined cylindrical area large enough to accommodate the calibration head’s area of contact.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_StepsOverview_CalibrationSteps_ListB.Text
data.value: Jog 6 times radially into the component

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_StepsOverview_ReviewSteps_ListA.Text
data.value: Review the result. Choose whether or not to save the calibration if the calibration is approved.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_TouchWorkpieceStep_ListA.Text
data.value: Jog the calibration head carefully into contact with the component.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_TouchWorkpieceStep_ListB.Text
data.value: Stop jogging when the contact indicator turns green.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_TouchWorkpieceStep_ListC.Text
data.value: Leave the bar in this position and click "Continue".

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_TouchWorkpieceStep_Recommendation.Text
data.value: We recommend not using a shim or paper to make contact with the component. Jog carefully while monitoring the indicator on this page to detect when you are in contact. Remember that the spindle should be stationary at all times.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_UpdateNoLoadStep_Text.Text
data.value: To remove any errors from system slack, we need to set a new no-load baseline after the pre-loading step.

data.name: DeflectionCalibration_UpdateTouchWorkpieceStep_Text.Text
data.value: This step sets an updated reference point in slight contact with the component.

data.name: FirmwareUpdateDialog.Title
data.comment: Title for firmware update dialog.

data.name: FirmwareUpdateRequest_Available_Text
data.value: A firmware update is available for the selected device. We highly recommend using the latest firmware version.
data.comment: Firmware update: Text describing that a firmware update is available.

data.name: FirmwareUpdateRequest_Available_Title
data.comment: Firmware update: Title for a dialog explaining that a firmware update is available.

data.name: FirmwareUpdateRequest_Required_Text
data.value: A firmware update is required in order to communicate with the selected device.
data.comment: Firmware update: Text describing that a firmware update is required.

data.name: FirmwareUpdateRequest_Required_Title
data.comment: Firmware update: Title for a dialog explaining that a firmware update is required.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Available_LowBattery_Text
data.value: A firmware update is available for the selected device. Although we highly recommend using the latest firmware version, updating must be postponed until the battery has been charged and has at least 50 % of its capacity. Please recharge the battery before starting the update procedure.
data.comment: Firmware update: short text requesting the user to recharge the battery before performing firmware update.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Required_LowBattery_Text
data.value: A firmware update is required for the selected device. Please charge the battery to at least 50 % of its capacity before connecting again.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Restore_Text
data.value: We have detected that a previous attempt on updating firmware have failed. We're trying to restore it. Please do not disconnect or turn off the system during the update process.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Status_Failed
data.value: Firmware update failed. Please disconnect and reconnect all power sources to restart the electronic unit and try again. If the problem persists please contact your local Sandvik Coromant representative for support.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Status_Successful
data.comment: Firmware update: short status text describing that firmware update is successfully finished.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Status_Updating
data.comment: Firmware update: short status text describing how many modules have been updated. Example: Updating modules... (1/3)

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_Text.Text
data.value: Firmware update in progress. Please do not turn off or disconnect the system during the update process.
data.comment: Text describing that a firmware update is in progress.

data.name: FirmwareUpdate_TotalProgress.Text
data.comment: Firmware update: heading above a progress bar, showing the total progress for the operation.

data.name: First_Time_Setup_Text
data.value: Performing first time setup. Please wait.

data.name: Import_File_Text
data.value: Click browse to select a file to import.

data.name: License_Notification_ActivationCompleted_Text
data.value: You have successfully activated the license for the tool with serial number {0}.

data.name: License_Notification_ActivationFailed_Text
data.value: License and/or key for the tool with serial number {0} is not valid. Please reconnect to the sensorized tool and make sure the license key is entered correctly. If the problem persists, please contact Support or your local Sandvik Coromant representative.

data.name: License_Notification_DaysUntilOnline_Title
data.comment: Notification title when it is soon time to do an online check of license.

data.name: License_Notification_EnterKeyForSerialOrMachineId_Text
data.value: Please enter your license key for the sensorized tool with serial number {0}, or the machine with license request key {1}:

data.name: License_Notification_EnterKeyForSerial_Text
data.value: Please enter your license key for the sensorized tool with serial number {0}:
data.comment: Enter license key notification popup text, for specific serial number.

data.name: License_Notification_EnterKey_Text
data.comment: Enter license key notification popup text.

data.name: License_Notification_EnterKey_Title
data.comment: Enter license key notification popup title.

data.name: License_Notification_ExpiredGrace_Text_PluralDays
data.value: Your license has expired. You have {0} days left until it is deactivated.
data.comment: Expired license, but still in grace period. Countdown to how many days left before the license is deactivated. {0} indicates where the number of days are inserted. Used when more than 1, or 0 days left.

data.name: License_Notification_ExpiredGrace_Text_SingleDay
data.value: Your license has expired. You have {0} day left until it is deactivated.
data.comment: Expired license, but still in grace period. Countdown to how many days left before the license is deactivated. {0} indicates where the number of days are inserted. Used when 1 day left.

data.name: License_Notification_Expired_Text
data.value: Your license has expired. Please contact your local Sandvik Coromant representative to renew your license.
data.comment: Text in notification popup saying that the license has expired.

data.name: License_Notification_Expired_Title
data.comment: License expired notification popup title.

data.name: License_Notification_ForceOnline_Text
data.value: You have used up your current available offline period and must go online for a license check to qualify for a new offline period.
data.comment: Notification when the tablet has been offline for too long, saying that it has to be connected online to verify the license.

data.name: License_Notification_ImportFinished_FailedClock_Text
data.value: Unable to import license. Please verify your system clock.

data.name: License_Notification_ImportFinished_FailedFileFormat_Text
data.value: The selected file has an invalid format. Please make sure you have the correct license file.

data.name: License_Notification_ImportFinished_FailedSerialNumber_Text
data.value: Wrong serial number. The connected tool has serial number {0}, but the chosen file is for {1}.

data.name: License_Notification_ImportFinished_Success_Text
data.value: License successfully imported for serial number {0}.

data.name: License_Notification_ImportLicenseFile_Text
data.value: Online activation is unavailable. If you have a license file for offline activation, please click the "Browse" button below. Otherwise, the license will be activated next time the software is connected to the Internet.

data.name: License_Notification_Invalid_Text
data.value: License and/or key is not valid. Please reconnect to the Sensorized Tool and make sure that the license key is entered correctly. If the problem persists, please contact support or your local Sandvik Coromant representative.
data.comment: Invalid license notification popup text.

data.name: License_Notification_Invalid_Title
data.comment: Invalid license notification popup title.

data.name: License_Notification_NoInternet_Text
data.value: Your tool serial number has been registered. Please bring your tablet/laptop online and start the Sensorized Tools application to activate and receive the license.
data.comment: Notification describing that there is no Internet connectivity (needed to verify license)

data.name: License_Notification_NoInternet_Title
data.comment: Title for notification stating there is no Internet connectivity

data.name: License_Notification_TimeDifference_Text
data.value: The system time or date on your device seems to be set incorrectly. Please make sure the time and date is set correctly.
data.comment: Notification when receiving a response from the license server, and the server time and device time is out of sync. Suggest to synchronize time with a reliable source.

data.name: License_Notification_TimeDifference_Title
data.comment: Notification title when device time is out of sync with server time.

data.name: LiveView_CurrentCutTime.Text
data.comment: How long the current machining process (cut) has been going on.

data.name: LiveView_Notification_ResetInsertHistory_General_Text
data.value: Do you want to reset the insert history?

data.name: LiveView_Notification_ResetInsertHistory_Title
data.comment: Title of a dialog requesting confirmation before resetting the insert history.

data.name: LiveView_Notification_ResetLoadOffset_General_Text
data.value: Do you want to reset the load and deflection offset?

data.name: LiveView_Notification_ResetLoadOffset_Title
data.comment: Title of a dialog requesting confirmation before resetting the load offset.

data.name: LiveView_NumberOfCutsOnInsert.Text
data.comment: How many cuts the current insert has performed. Used to know when to change the insert.

data.name: LiveView_SurfaceRoughnessBar.Text
data.comment: The degree of bad surface quality, the amount bumps and marks - the roughness of a surface.

data.name: LiveView_TotalInsertTime.Text
data.comment: What is the total accumulated time the current insert edge has been machining.

data.name: LiveView_VibrationBar.Text
data.comment: Here, vibration is specifically referring vibration of tool/workpiece in a machining process. More technically called "chatter", but often reffered to (in english) as vibrations.

data.name: LiveView_WidgetDeflection.Title
data.comment: The bending distance of the turning adapter.

data.name: LiveView_WidgetHistory.Title
data.comment: The title of a graph showing the monitored parameters from the start of the cutting process until the current time.

data.name: LiveView_WidgetLoad.Title
data.comment: The load on the turning adapter, as a percentage of the maximum load/force, the turning adapter can withstand.

data.name: LiveView_WidgetProcessSummary.Title
data.comment: The title of a display area giving a brief summary of the process status. Same as earlier.

data.name: LiveView_WidgetRecord.Title
data.comment: Same as earlier…

data.name: LiveView_WidgetSurfaceQuality.Title
data.comment: Same as earlier…

data.name: LiveView_WidgetTemperature.Title
data.comment: Same as earlier…

data.name: LogEventDescription_SetUpperDeflectionLimit
data.value: Interface length unit is {1}. Upper deflection limit set to value {0}.

data.name: LogEventDescription_UpperDeflectionLimitOutOfRange
data.value: Unable to set upper deflection limit. Value out of range.

data.name: LogEventDescription_UpperLoadLimitOutOfRange
data.value: Unable to set upper load limit. Value out of range.

data.name: LogEventDescription_UpperTemperatureLimitOutOfRange
data.value: Unable to set upper temperature limit. Value out of range.

data.name: LogEventDescription_UpperVibrationLimitOutOfRange
data.value: Unable to set upper vibration limit. Value out of range.

data.name: MachineAction_DeflectionOutsideOfLimits_Description
data.value: Any time the deflection of the sensorized tool is outside of the set limits, this action type will be sent to the machine. The value field is not used. The action type will not be resent until the deflection has returned to the acceptable range and then exceeded the limits again.

data.name: MachineAction_DeflectionOutsideOfLimits_RecommendedUse
data.value: If the deflection goes outside of the set limits, a good action may be to stop the process and retract the sensorized tool out of cut, if there is a risk that dimensional tolerances can be exceeded.

data.name: MachineAction_IsReadyToMachine_Description
data.value: This action type will be acknowledged and reset when the system is ready to machine, which includes verifying a connection to the sensorized tool. Establishing a connection to the sensorized tool may take a few seconds, so the machine should wait for the reply before proceeding. In addition, the zero-point for load and deflection will be set.

data.name: MachineAction_IsReadyToMachine_RecommendedUse
data.value: This action type should be sent prior to each cutting process, with the sensorized tool stationary and not in contact with material (no load on the tool).

data.name: MachineAction_LoadOutsideOfLimits_Description
data.value: Any time the load detected by the sensorized tool is outside of the set limits, this action type will be sent to the machine. The value field is not used. The action type will be resent if the load situation persists after the action is acknowledged and reset.

data.name: MachineAction_LoadOutsideOfLimits_RecommendedUse
data.value: Abort the process and retract the sensorized tool to a safe distance, out of cut.

data.name: MachineAction_MachineReset_Description
data.value: This action type indicates that the machine has been reset. The Sensorized Tools application will reset all feed and speed overrides, finish the active action request, and clear the action queue.

data.name: MachineAction_MachineReset_RecommendedUse
data.value: This action type should not be sent manually, but handled according to the CoroPlus® Connected Machine Interface Specification.

data.name: MachineAction_Ping_Description
data.value: The Ping action type can be used to check the full communication path. Either the CoroPlus software can send a ping to the machine and expect a reply, or the CNC machine can ping the CoroPlus software and expect a reply.

data.name: MachineAction_Ping_RecommendedUse
data.value: Ping can be used to check the system, without using one of the other action types. It can be sent manually from the software, or even automated from the CNC side if desirable.

data.name: MachineAction_RequestActiveToolLocation_Description
data.value: Requests the currently active tool location ID from the machine. This action allows the Sensorized Tools software to be certain what tool is being used, and specifically if a Bluetooth connection should be established or disconnected. Only used if the software is uncertain about what tool is in use, typically just after the software has been started.

data.name: MachineAction_RequestActiveToolLocation_RecommendedUse
data.value: This function is being automatically used by the Sensorized Tools software if active tool ID data is missing. It can be tested here to verify the signal path: a "Tool location ID" action should be received from the machine shortly after sending this action.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperDeflectionLimit_Description
data.value: This action type will update and set the active upper deflection limit in the Sensorized Tools software. The value field should contain the new limit. The units used follow the ones chosen in the application settings, i.e. metric or inch. In metric mode, the limit value is transferred as an integer number in thousandths of millimeters, i.e. 0.09mm should be sent as value 90. In inches, the limit value is transferred as an integer number in ten-thousandths of an inch, i.e. 0.0043in should be sent as 43. The value needs to be within the range of 0.01-5mm and the equivalent in inches. Setting the value to 0 will disable the deflection limit.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperDeflectionLimit_RecommendedUse
data.value: Set deflection limits before each cut, or as desired. Limiting the allowed deflection value can be a good way to avoid going out of tolerance, due to tool wear, material or process variations. Setup problems resulting in a too large cut could also be detected.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperLoadLimit_Description
data.value: This action type will update and set the active upper load limit in the Sensorized Tools software. The value field should contain the new limit in percent, expressed as whole number (i.e. 34 %). The acceptable range is from {0} % to {1} %.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperLoadLimit_RecommendedUse
data.value: Set limits in NC code before each cut. The limits may also be updated during a cut if desired. Identify the desired limits during process run-in by observing the load value in the software user interface. The limit should be set close enough to the expected load to detect any unwanted abnormality.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperTemperatureLimit_Description
data.value: This action type will update and set the active upper temperature limit in the Sensorized Tools software. The value field will be interpreted according to the temperature unit chosen under application settings. The value can be any whole number between 10-75 °C or 50-167 °F respectively.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperTemperatureLimit_RecommendedUse
data.value: Set limits before each cut or as desired. If higher temperatures affect process stability during run-in, a limit could be imposed to stay within an acceptable range by observing the temperature value in the software user interface.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperVibrationLimit_Description
data.value: This action type will update and set the active upper vibration limit in the Sensorized Tools software. The value field should contain the new limit in percent, expressed as a whole number. The acceptable range is from {0} % to {1} %. Setting the value to 0 % will disable the vibration protection.

data.name: MachineAction_SetUpperVibrationLimit_RecommendedUse
data.value: Set limits before each cut or as desired. Process run-in is a good time to investigate and set the limits based on the values seen in the software user interface.

data.name: MachineAction_SupplyVoltageLow_Description
data.value: Any time the supply voltage of the sensorized tool is critically low, e.g. the battery is depleted, this action type will be sent to the machine. The value field is not used.

data.name: MachineAction_SupplyVoltageLow_RecommendedUse
data.value: Notify the machine operator, as the process will have to be manually monitored if no electrical power is available to the sensorized tool. Alternatively, the machine may finish the current operation and then wait for a battery replacement.

data.name: MachineAction_SystemUnavailable_Description
data.value: In the rare event that the system detects a problem reducing its monitoring capabilities, this action type will be sent. Examples include an empty battery or a loss of wireless communication. The operator should consult the Sensorized Tools user interface to see what the problem is, so it can be remedied.

data.name: MachineAction_SystemUnavailable_RecommendedUse
data.value: Notify the machine operator, as the process will have to be manually monitored until normal functionality is restored. Alternatively, you may choose to abort the process.

data.name: MachineAction_TemperatureOutsideOfLimits_Description
data.value: Any time the internal temperature of the sensorized tool is outside of the set limits, this action type will be sent to the machine. The value field is not used. The action type will not be resent until the temperature has returned to the acceptable range and then moved outside of the limits again.

data.name: MachineAction_TemperatureOutsideOfLimits_RecommendedUse
data.value: Depending on the machining process, alternatives might be to notify the machine operator, finish the operation and then wait for the temperature to reach an acceptable level before continuing machining, or turn on or increase coolant.

data.name: MachineAction_VibrationOutsideOfLimits_Description
data.value: Any time the vibration detected by the sensorized tool is outside of the set limits, this action type will be sent to the machine. The value field is not used. The action type will be resent if the vibration situation persists or resurfaces.

data.name: MachineAction_VibrationOutsideOfLimits_RecommendedUse
data.value: During a critical finishing pass it might be best to abort the process and retract the sensorized tool to a safe distance. Alternatives could be to increase the feed rate or start spindle speed variations.

data.name: MachineInteraction_Warning_LostConnection
data.value: Machine interface connection lost. Please ensure the HMS Anybus unit still has power and is connected properly, then restart this application.
data.comment: Warning message stating that the connection to the machine interface has been lost. Includes some troubleshooting tips for checking that the HMS Anybus unit is powered on and connected. To connect again, restart the application.

data.name: Machine_Notification_ConfigurationMismatch_Text
data.value: The provided configuration does not match the connected machine. Please ensure that the correct configuration is used.

data.name: Machine_Notification_ConnectionLost_Text
data.value: The connection to the machine has been lost. We will try reconnecting, but please ensure all components are powered on and that cables are intact and working as expected.

data.name: Machine_Notification_InvalidLicense_Text
data.value: The connected bar does not have an active license for machine integrated functionality. You may still use the software to view live data. Contact your Sandvik Coromant representative to unlock the machine integrated features for this bar.

data.name: Machine_Notification_UnableToConnect_Text
data.value: We were unable to establish a connection to the machine. Please ensure all cables are connected and intact, and all components powered. Do you want to try again?
data.comment: Warning message stating that no connection could be established to the machine interface. Includes some troubleshooting tips for checking that the HMS Anybus unit is powered on and connected. To connect again, restart the application.

data.name: Metadata_DeleteProcessVerification
data.value: Please verify that you want to delete the process.

data.name: NameAscending
data.comment: Option for ordering a list by name, ascending.

data.name: NameDescending
data.comment: Option for ordering a list by name, descending.

data.name: Navigate_Confirmation_Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to abort the calibration? The current progress of the calibration routine will be lost, and you will need to start over.

data.name: NewsArticle_New
data.comment: This text is placed on a little tag next to a new and unread news article.

data.name: NewsArticle_Updated
data.comment: News updated

data.name: NPass_CenterInTolerance
data.comment: Go to the center the tolerance

data.name: NPass_CutSide
data.comment: Short description for switch

data.name: NPass_Diameter_Initial_Measured
data.comment: Value from an initial measurement of the diameter

data.name: NPass_Diameter_Target
data.comment: The diameter you wish to end up with

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_Diameter_Target_Nominal_LowerThanMeasured
data.value: This value must be higher than the "Measured initial diameter"
data.comment: "Measured initial diameter" = NPass_Diameter_Initial_Measured

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_TargetDiameter_TooHigh
data.comment: A value that is "too high" for a given limit

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_TargetDiameter_TooLow
data.comment: A value that is "too low" for a given limit

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_Tolerance_Warning_Equal
data.value: Warning: Higher and lower tolerances can not be equal

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_Tolerance_Warning_LowerMoreThanUpper
data.value: The lower tolerance should be less than the upper.

data.name: NPass_InputValidaton_Tolerance_Warning_UpperLessThanLower
data.value: The upper tolerance should be larger than the lower

data.name: NPass_ISOTolerance
data.comment: "International Organization for Standardization" Tolerance

data.name: NPass_PassHistory
data.comment: Title text / heading

data.name: NPass_ProgrammedDiameters
data.comment: Title of a set of input values for programmed diameters

data.name: NPass_ProgrammedDiameter_Pass
data.comment: List field description

data.name: NPass_Result
data.comment: Title on a page showing results.

data.name: NPass_SetupInformation
data.comment: Title text / heading

data.name: NPass_TargetDiameter
data.comment: Describing that a value is a diametrical target

data.name: NPass_TitleSetup
data.comment: Title on a page showin setup.

data.name: NPass_Tolerance_Lower
data.comment: Lowest point within a tolerance range

data.name: NPass_Tolerance_Upper
data.comment: Highest point within a tolerance range

data.name: NPass_Workflow_Diametrical
data.comment: Short description for switch, toggeling between a radial or diametrical workflow

data.name: NPass_Workflow_Radial
data.comment: Short description for switch toggeling between a radial or diametrical workflow

data.name: PageTitle_Connect
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Navigation bar - page title for connect page.

data.name: PageTitle_LiveView
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Navigation bar - page title for live view page. This is the page the user will be on to watch live data from the turning adapter and cutting process.

data.name: PageTitle_News
data.comment: Menue item title for going to the "news" page

data.name: PageTitle_Playground
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Navigation bar - page title for playground page. This page is used for development and Beta features.

data.name: PageTitle_Settings
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Navigation bar - page title for settings page.

data.name: PageTitle_ToolSetup
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Navigation bar - page title for tool setup page

data.name: Push_the_refresh_button_to_try_again
data.value: Please ensure the tool you would like to connect to is powered on and in range, and click the refresh button to scan again.

data.name: Recording_DiscardRecordingText
data.value: Are you sure you want to discard the recording? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: Recording_StopRecordingConfirmation_Message
data.value: Are you sure you want to stop recording?

data.name: Report_InCut
data.comment: Meaning that the tool is currenctly in contact with the metal, performing the cutting process.

data.name: Report_OutOfCut
data.comment: Denotes that the tool is no longer cutting, and also the event of the tool exiting/finishing the cut.

data.name: Search
data.comment: Placeholder text for a search input box

data.name: Sensor_Missing_Notification_Text
data.value: Unable to communicate with one or more of the sensors in the tool. Some functionality will be unavailable. Please ensure any cables between electronics module and sensorized tool is properly connected, and retry, by removing and reinserting the battery after the cables are properly fastened and then connect from the software again. If the problem persists, please contact your local Sandvik Coromant sales representative for support.
data.comment: Sensor missing notification text, explaining that some functionality will not be available.

data.name: Sensor_Missing_Notification_Title
data.comment: Sensor missing notification title.

data.name: Sensor_Missing_No_Sensors_Notification_Text
data.value: No sensors are connected to the electronics module. Please make sure the cable between the electronics module and the turning adapter is connected correctly and retry. If the problem persists, don't hesitate to contact your local Sandvik Coromant sales representative for support.
data.comment: Notification when no sensors are connected. Also telling the user that it will disconnect from the tool.

data.name: Sensor_Missing_StatusNotification_Text
data.value: Unable to communicate with one or more sensors.

data.name: Settings_License_End_Date.Text
data.comment: Referring to a date of licence expiry.

data.name: Settings_License_Status_Active
data.comment: Active licence status

data.name: Settings_License_Status_Expired
data.comment: Licence has expired.

data.name: Settings_Notification_ToolRestartRequired_Text
data.value: The electronics module must be restarted for the new name to take effect.

data.name: Settings_Pending_Restart
data.value: Some settings do not take effect until app is restarted

data.name: Settings_ToolInfo_MaxCoolantPressure.Text
data.comment: Maximum coolant fluid pressure allowed

data.name: Settings_UnitsAndMachineEditWarning
data.value: These settings affect the interpretation of the values received from the CNC machine. When using limits, values received from the machine will always be interpreted using the selected application settings.

data.name: Settings_WidgetAbout.Title
data.comment: Settings page - About widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetCutSensitivity.Title
data.comment: Settings page - Cut detection sensitivity widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetHelp.Title
data.comment: Settings page - Help widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetLanguage.Title
data.comment: Settings - language selector header.

data.name: Settings_WidgetLicense.Title
data.comment: Settings page - License info widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetThresholds.Title
data.comment: Settings page - Thresholds widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetToolName.Title
data.comment: Settings page - Tool name widget title.

data.name: Settings_WidgetUnits.Title
data.comment: Settings - units selector header.

data.name: Source
data.comment: data source

data.name: StatusEnum_BATTERY_CRITICAL
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text based feedback to the user that the battery level is critically low.

data.name: StatusEnum_BATTERY_LOW
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text based feedback to the user that the battery level is low.

data.name: StatusEnum_CALIBRATION
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) An indication that the software is gathering data and still calculating the remaining battery time. This is shown until a time estimate is given.

data.name: StatusEnum_CHATTER
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text alert that the software has detected vibrations in the machining process. Technically reffered to as Chatter.

data.name: StatusEnum_CHATTER_INTENSE
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text alert that the software has detected intense vibrations in the machining process. Technically reffered to as intense Chatter.

data.name: StatusEnum_CHATTER_SLIGHT
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text alert that the software has detected slight vibrations (chatter) in the machining process.

data.name: StatusEnum_CONNECTION_UNRELIABLE
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) When experiencing too high packet loss

data.name: StatusEnum_CUT_IN
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text feedback to user that the tool is in contact with the material and the cutting process is progressing.

data.name: StatusEnum_CUT_OUT
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text feedback to the user informing that the tool is now not machining any more and the cutting process is over.

data.name: StatusEnum_DeflectionLimitSet
data.value: New deflection limit set from machine

data.name: StatusEnum_DeflectionOutsideOfLimits
data.value: Deflection outside limit, machine interrupt sent

data.name: StatusEnum_INSERT_DURATION_HIGH
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text warning that the insert (the exchangeable cutting edge of the machining tool) is nearing its maximum allowable duration of use.

data.name: StatusEnum_INSERT_DURATION_OVER
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text warning that the insert (the exchangeable cutting edge of the machining tool) has passed its maximum allowable duration of use.

data.name: StatusEnum_LoadLimitSet
data.value: New load limit set from machine

data.name: StatusEnum_LOAD_HIGH
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text warning that the tool is nearly overloaded. Too high forces acting on the tool.

data.name: StatusEnum_LOAD_OVER
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text warning that the tool is overloaded, with exceedingly large forces, and may be permanently damaged by these forces.

data.name: StatusEnum_LOAD_OVER_SAFE_RETRACT
data.value: Load outside limit, machine interrupt sent
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) An alert that the tool is stopping and retracaing (aborting the cutting process) due to some paramterer being out of bounds.

data.name: StatusEnum_LOST_CONNECTION
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) When the tool disconnects unexpected

data.name: StatusEnum_NOT_CONNECTED
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text alert that the tool is not connected (Bluetooth).

data.name: StatusEnum_READY
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Text alert that the tool is ready to start a cutting process.

data.name: StatusEnum_RECONNECTING
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Alert that the software is currently attempting to reconnect to the tool.

data.name: StatusEnum_SENSOR_MISSING
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Alert that one or more sensor is lost. Used in process summary tile.

data.name: StatusEnum_TemperatureLimitSet
data.value: New temperature limit set from machine

data.name: StatusEnum_TemperatureOutsideOfLimits
data.value: Temperature outside limit, machine interrupt sent

data.name: StatusEnum_TEMPERATURE_HIGH
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Alert that the tool's internal temperature is near its maximum.

data.name: StatusEnum_TEMPERATURE_LOW
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Alert that the tool's internal temperature is near its minimum.

data.name: StatusEnum_TEMPERATURE_OVER
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) Alert that the tool's internal temperature is over its maximum acceptable value.

data.name: StatusEnum_VibrationLimitSet
data.value: New vibration limit set from machine

data.name: StatusEnum_VIBRATION_OVER_SAFE_RETRACT
data.value: Vibration outside limit, machine interrupt sent
data.comment: (NB: Short phrase required due to GUI layout) An alert that the tool is stopping and retracting (aborting the cutting process) due to some paramterer being out of bounds.

data.name: Surface_Acceptable
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Referring to, for example, a sufficiently good surface or sufficiently low vibration levels. Within the desired boundraries.

data.name: Surface_Finishing
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Here referring to the the surface quality obtained by a final cut/pass of a machining process, whose aim is to get a good surface, and the tolerances just right, and that is often a fine/precision cut.

data.name: Surface_Medium
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Refering to the surface quality obtained by a medium cutting process (between the roughing and finishing operations), resulting in a medium surface quality, which is not a fine surface, but not a rough one either.

data.name: Surface_NotAcceptable
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Phrase used to describe a surface with a parameter that is outside of the acceptable level. Such as too high vibrations, or too bad of a surface.

data.name: Surface_Roughing
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) This refers to the resulting surface quality when performing a roughing machining process. This is normally a forceful machining process leaving a rough or bumpy surface.

data.name: Time
data.comment: General purpose - label for "time" axis on graphs

data.name: Time_Hour_Short
data.comment: As short as possible for hours (preferred 1 letter).

data.name: Time_Minute_Short
data.comment: As short as possible for minutes (preferred 1 letter).

data.name: ToolSettings_Notification_NewPreset_Text
data.value: Please enter a unique name for the preset.

data.name: ToolSettings_Notification_PresetNameAlreadyExists_Text
data.value: A preset named "{0}" already exists. Please provide a different name.

data.name: ToolSettings_Notification_PresetNameTooLong_Text
data.value: The preset name must be shorter than {0} characters.

data.name: ToolSettings_Notification_RenamePreset_Text
data.value: Please enter a new name for the preset.

data.name: ToolSettings_Notification_SavePresetError_Text
data.value: We were unable to save the changes.

data.name: ToolSetup_AbsoluteAngle
data.comment: Absolute Angle is the angle of the tool's current orientation.

data.name: ToolSetup_OffsetAngle.Text
data.comment: Offset Angle is the angle between the tool's current orientation and the desired orientation.

data.name: Unit_Celsius
data.comment: Short for Celsius

data.name: Unit_Fahrenheit
data.comment: Short for Fahrenheit

data.name: Unit_Inch
data.comment: Short acronym for US Customary Inches. Settings - select length units (in, inch)

data.name: Unit_Millimeter
data.comment: Short acronym for Metric millimeters. Settings - select length units (mm, millimeters)

data.name: UploadFile_Message
data.value: Select a file using the "Browse" button below.

data.name: Verification_DiscardUnsavedChanges.Text
data.value: Please verify that you want to discard any unsaved changes

data.name: VerifyPermanentAction.Text
data.value: Please verify that you want to continue

data.name: Warning
data.comment: Short text for displaying a warning, typically used in the title of a message box or similar.

data.name: XX_Button_Cancel
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Button for popup notifications with response needed from the user.

data.name: XX_Button_OK
data.comment: (NB: short text required due to GUI design) Button for popup notifications with response needed from the user.

data.name: Common_Diameter
data.comment: Field descriptor for the a "diameter" of something

data.name: Common_Machine
data.comment: Field descriptor for the name of a "machine"

data.name: Common_Overhang
data.comment: Field descriptor for an "overhang". The length of a tool in free air, measured from the end of a tool holder to the end of the tool.

data.name: Common_Required
data.comment: Something is "Required" to be able to continue etc.

data.name: Common_Tool
data.comment: Field descriptor for the name of a "tool"

data.name: Common_ToolHolder
data.comment: Field descriptor for the name of a "tool holder"

data.name: Metadata_MeasurementInformation
data.comment: Title / field descriptor for information about a "measurement"

data.name: Metadata_ReferenceInformation
data.comment: Title / field descriptor for information about some "reference"

data.name: Common_PleaseVerifyRestart
data.value: Please verify that you want to restart

data.name: Common_Measurement
data.comment: Field descriptor for a "Measurement"

data.name: RequiredField_Text
data.value: This field requires an input to be able to continue

data.name: ToolCheck_ToolStatusChecker
data.comment: Tool status checker name in particular form

data.name: Metadata_MeasuredOverhang
data.comment: The actual (measured) overhang of a tool, when set up in a tool holder.

data.name: Metadata_OHN
data.comment: Short for describing a tools maximum overhang

data.name: Metadata_OHX
data.comment: Short for describing a tools minimum overhang

data.name: Temperature_WaitToStabilize
data.value: Please wait for temperature to stabilize

data.name: Settings_ExtendedStatusbar.Title
data.comment: Setting to show more information about a status in a statusbar

data.name: Common_Hits
data.comment: One word counter description for how many times something is hit. (5 of 10 hits)

data.name: Common_NotReady
data.comment: Short status text for something that is: not ready

data.name: Measurement_CCWFromTolerance
data.value: Hit was too far counter clockwise compared to tolerance

data.name: Measurement_CWFromTolerance
data.value: Hit was too far clockwise compared to tolerance

data.name: Measurement_Direction
data.comment: Short title.

data.name: Measurement_DoubleHitDetected
data.value: More more than one hit detected

data.name: Measurement_Force
data.comment: Short title.

data.name: Measurement_HitDetected
data.comment: Short status text for when a measurement detects a (hammer) hit

data.name: Measurement_Measurements
data.comment: Short title.

data.name: Measurement_NotWithinTolerance
data.comment: Short status text.

data.name: Measurement_TooHard
data.comment: Short status text.

data.name: Measurement_TooWeak
data.comment: Short status text.

data.name: Measurement_WithinTolerance
data.comment: Short status text.

data.name: ToolCheck_StopConfirmation_Message
data.value: A tool check is ongoing. Do you want to stop it and quit the application? You will lose the current progress.

data.name: ToolCheck_LostConnection
data.value: Could not complete the current tool check. The connection was lost.

data.name: ToolCheck_GoodToGoText
data.value: Your measurement is within tolerance compared with your reference

data.name: LogEventDescription_LogDbReset
data.value: Old log was lost due to an error.

data.name: LogEventDescription_LogDbBackup
data.value: Log continues from backup, some entries might be missing.

data.name: Export_Files_Successfull_Open_Folder
data.value: Successfully exported {0} files. Do you want to open the folder where the files are located ({1})?

data.name: QuitApplication_Confirm_Message
data.value: Please confirm that you want to quit the application.
